info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 6:32PM EDT until May 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR WYTHE AND CENTRAL BLAND COUNTIES... At 631 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Kimberling to near Bland to near Wytheville to near Speedwell, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wytheville... Bland... Rural Retreat... Max Meadows... Patterson... Speedwell... and Bastian. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northwestern North Carolina...and southwestern Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of hail of any size, as well as reports of any wind damage, including downed trees or large limbs, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. Additional statements will be issued as conditions warrant.
